metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10218 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in the samba client, all samba versions before samba4.11.2, 4.10.10 and 4.9.15, where a malicious server can supply a pathnameto the client with separators. This could allow the client to access filesand folders outside of the SMB network pathnames. An attacker could usethis vulnerability to create files outside of the current working directoryusing the privileges of the client user.

criterions.comment: samba: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
